author: pdobacz
content: What was the rationale of calling it `EXCHANGE` rather than `SWAPNM`?

author: _shemnon
content: My google perusal shows that other opcode architectures use the name exchange more than they use swap when having values trade places.  mostly register based opcodes however.

author: big_tech_sux
content: Not a huge rationale, it was just deemed that SWAP_N_M might be confusing compared to SWAP

author: big_tech_sux
content: I think having both swap and exchange is kind of confusing from a vocabulary perspective (they mean essentially the same thing in english)

author: big_tech_sux
content: They could be differentiated better with suffixes imo. Maybe SWAP_G (for "swap generic")
